p: Test results for COVID-19 can lead to the initial steps in identifying the scale of the pandemic. With the data from the test results, mathematical models can be created to aid governorsâ€™ decisions about the length of time for stay-at-home orders. Previously, reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) tests were the diagnostic method of choice. However, these methods are not ideal for rapid diagnosis due to their long wait times of two to three hours, as well as the need for expensive laboratory equipment and trained professionals ( Figure 1c).
